svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 11, 2023" date: "2023-03-11"
Eth News and Links
Shapella (Shanghai + Capella) upgrade
* Update your Goerli testnet nodes ready for Shapella upgrade on March 14
Update your Goerli testnet nodes ready for Shapella upgrade on March 14
* Consensus layer Sepolia releases: Lighthouse v3.5.1 Lodestar v1.5.1 Nimbus v23.3.0
Prysm v3.2.2 Teku v23.3.0
Consensus layer Sepolia releases:
* Lighthouse v3.5.1
Lighthouse v3.5.1
* Lodestar v1.5.1
Lodestar v1.5.1
* Nimbus v23.3.0
Nimbus v23.3.0
* Prysm v3.2.2
Prysm v3.2.2
* Teku v23.3.0
Teku v23.3.0
* Execution layer Sepolia releases: Besu v23.1.1 Erigon v2.40.1 Geth v1.11.4 Nethermind
Execution layer Sepolia releases:
* Besu v23.1.1
Besu v23.1.1
* Erigon v2.40.1
Erigon v2.40.1
* Geth v1.11.4
Geth v1.11.4
* Nethermind
Nethermind
* MEV-Boost guide updated with recommended versions for Shapella Goerli upgrade
MEV-Boost guide updated with recommended versions for Shapella Goerli upgrade
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim : Discussions on blob signing API, SSZ, adding parent slot to
blocks/attestations and draft Verge spec
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim :
* Discussions on blob signing API, SSZ, adding parent slot to blocks/attestations and
draft Verge spec
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* KZG Ceremony: 71k+ contributors , 19k+ in the lobby, only 2 days left in first
general contribution period
KZG Ceremony:
* 71k+ contributors , 19k+ in the lobby, only 2 days left in first
* Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence
Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence
Layer 1
* Proposal for execution layer clients to suggest using a local block based on their
view of execution data
Proposal for execution layer clients to suggest using a local block based on their view
of execution data
* Verkle testnet Kaustinen reborn, using proofs in blocks to conform with the consensus
spec
Verkle testnet Kaustinen reborn, using proofs in blocks to conform with the consensus
* Ethereum Protocol Fellows cohort 3 projects & final presentations [video]
Ethereum Protocol Fellows cohort 3 projects & final presentations [video]
* E-star name discussion for Consensus Layer upgrade after Deneb
E-star name discussion for Consensus Layer upgrade after Deneb
Layer 2
* Arbitrum proposal to reduce challenge period for optimistic rollups , uses Proof of
Stake discrete slot times to detect possible forking censorship (block filtering)
Arbitrum proposal to reduce challenge period for optimistic rollups , uses Proof of
* Justin Drake: based (L1 sequenced) rollups , L1 proposers include rollup blocks as
part of L1 blocks
Justin Drake: based (L1 sequenced) rollups , L1 proposers include rollup blocks as part
of L1 blocks
* Concept of multi-verifiers for validating bridges : increases security but at the
expense of bridging cost
Concept of multi-verifiers for validating bridges : increases security but at the
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP712 : Typed structured data hashing and signing; (updated to match common
implementations without author approval ) EIP6601 : EVM Modular Arithmetic Extensions
(EVMMAX)
EIPs:
* EIP712 : Typed structured data hashing and signing; (updated to match common
implementations without author approval )
EIP712 : Typed structured data hashing and signing; (updated to match common
* EIP6601 : EVM Modular Arithmetic Extensions (EVMMAX)
EIP6601 : EVM Modular Arithmetic Extensions (EVMMAX)
* ERCs: ERC6617 : Bit based permission ERC6662 : AA account metadata for authentication
(ERC4337 extension) ERC6672 : Multi-redeemable NFTs
ERCs:
* ERC6617 : Bit based permission
ERC6617 : Bit based permission
* ERC6662 : AA account metadata for authentication (ERC4337 extension)
ERC6662 : AA account metadata for authentication (ERC4337 extension)
* ERC6672 : Multi-redeemable NFTs
ERC6672 : Multi-redeemable NFTs
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Tenderly ’s Web3 Gateway !
The Tenderly platform enables Web3 developers to build, test, monitor, and operate
smart contracts in one place. To cover each aspect of the dapp development lifecycle,
Tenderly expanded its product offering and released Tenderly Web3 Gateway. This is a
production node as a service that delivers fast and easy access to the blockchain.
Tenderly Web3 Gateway is fully integrated with the rest of the platform, combining
infrastructure with development tooling and observability. It enables blockchain
developers to:
* Speed up read-heavy workloads up to eight times
Speed up read-heavy workloads up to eight times
* Set up reliable node infrastructure with 100% blockchain data consistency
Set up reliable node infrastructure with 100% blockchain data consistency
* Reduce node infrastructure management overhead
Reduce node infrastructure management overhead
* Scale dapps with ease to meet their growing user base
Scale dapps with ease to meet their growing user base
* Unify dapp development by combining infrastructure with tooling and observability
Unify dapp development by combining infrastructure with tooling and observability
* Improve development teams’ velocity and collaboration by eliminating development
silos
Improve development teams’ velocity and collaboration by eliminating development silos
* Preview transaction outcomes directly from Tenderly Web3 Gateway before sending them
on-chain
Preview transaction outcomes directly from Tenderly Web3 Gateway before sending them
Try Tenderly Web3 Gateway .
Stuff for developers
* Solidity developer survey 2022 results : Hardhat usage at 75%, Remix 42%, Foundry
jumped to 30%, Truffle down to 17%; Solidity v0.8 usage at 90%
Solidity developer survey 2022 results : Hardhat usage at 75%, Remix 42%, Foundry
* Goerlinator : ETH Denver attendees can claim 50 Goerli ETH
Goerlinator : ETH Denver attendees can claim 50 Goerli ETH
* SS2ERC721 : batch mints for up to 1228 addresses using SSTORE2, experimental
SS2ERC721 : batch mints for up to 1228 addresses using SSTORE2, experimental
* Console.huff : console.log for Huff, uses Foundry with experimental StdStyle support
Console.huff : console.log for Huff, uses Foundry with experimental StdStyle support
* snekmate v0.0.1 (Vyper contracts): ERC20/721/1155/4626, ownable/access control &
utilities
snekmate v0.0.1 (Vyper contracts): ERC20/721/1155/4626, ownable/access control &
* ethers.js v6 (soft launched) & v6.1 : ES2020 BigInt replaces BigNumber, imports in
the root package and Typed API to call contracts
ethers.js v6 (soft launched) & v6.1 : ES2020 BigInt replaces BigNumber, imports in the
root package and Typed API to call contracts
* viem : lightweight composable TypeScript modules to interface Ethereum (alternative
to ethers.js/web3.js)
viem : lightweight composable TypeScript modules to interface Ethereum (alternative to
ethers.js/web3.js)
* Scaffold-Eth v2 : Typescript, NextJS, wagmi, RainbowKit & Hardhat; contract hot
reloading & burner wallets
Scaffold-Eth v2 : Typescript, NextJS, wagmi, RainbowKit & Hardhat; contract hot
* noble-curves : JavaScript library for elliptic curves now production-ready
noble-curves : JavaScript library for elliptic curves now production-ready
* AnyABI : fetch ABI using chain ID & address for contracts verified on Etherscan or
Sourcify
AnyABI : fetch ABI using chain ID & address for contracts verified on Etherscan or
* Equivalence checking using Halmos (symbolic execution tool)
Equivalence checking using Halmos (symbolic execution tool)
* CTFs: Curta CTF 2 × 4 = 8 challenge solved using Halmos Curta CTF 0xF1A9 challenge
solution using Foundry Base challenge solution using Foundry Ethernaut in Yul using
Foundry Sussy Huff solution
CTFs:
* Curta CTF 2 × 4 = 8 challenge solved using Halmos
Curta CTF 2 × 4 = 8 challenge solved using Halmos
* Curta CTF 0xF1A9 challenge solution using Foundry
Curta CTF 0xF1A9 challenge solution using Foundry
* Base challenge solution using Foundry
Base challenge solution using Foundry
* Ethernaut in Yul using Foundry
Ethernaut in Yul using Foundry
* Sussy Huff solution
Sussy Huff solution
* Dune SQL : queries as views, querying using addresses and 256 bit integer data types
Dune SQL : queries as views, querying using addresses and 256 bit integer data types
* Echidna v2.1.0 : on-chain fuzzing using state via RPC, experimental Windows support
Echidna v2.1.0 : on-chain fuzzing using state via RPC, experimental Windows support
* Semaphore v3.2.0 : Sepolia & Optimism Goerli testnet support, SemaphoreEthers to
fetch on-chain data
Semaphore v3.2.0 : Sepolia & Optimism Goerli testnet support, SemaphoreEthers to fetch
on-chain data
Security
* Tender Finance $1.59 million exploit via decimal error in oracle integration, 62 ETH
bounty agreed
Ecosystem
* Phil Daian: geographic decentralization needed to avoid centralization
Phil Daian: geographic decentralization needed to avoid centralization
* ETHDenver videos and hackathon winners
ETHDenver videos and hackathon winners
* ETHGlobal postponed Istanbul (likely until November), added Lisbon as a replacement,
moved Toronto to Waterloo and added Pragma 1 day conference
ETHGlobal postponed Istanbul (likely until November), added Lisbon as a replacement,
* Etherscan adds gas guzzlers, block producers & contract statistics dashboards
Etherscan adds gas guzzlers, block producers & contract statistics dashboards
Enterprise
* Coinbase Wallet as a Service : APIs to create Multi-Party Computation (MPC) wallets,
split between the end user & Coinbase
Application layer
* Privacy Pools v0 : live on Optimism, non-custodial mixer with opt-in/opt-out
anonymity sets, unaudited, experimental
Privacy Pools v0 : live on Optimism, non-custodial mixer with opt-in/opt-out anonymity
sets, unaudited, experimental
* Oasis disabled upgradeability after funds were recovered from Wormhole exploiter
Oasis disabled upgradeability after funds were recovered from Wormhole exploiter
* Iron Bank froze Alpha Homora accounts due to $30 million debt from 2021 exploit
Iron Bank froze Alpha Homora accounts due to $30 million debt from 2021 exploit
* Maker proposal to buy additional $750 million in US Treasuries
Maker proposal to buy additional $750 million in US Treasuries
* Element Finance Council Kit : SDK to create & manage DAOs
Element Finance Council Kit : SDK to create & manage DAOs
* Senate : track governance proposals across various DAOs
Senate : track governance proposals across various DAOs
* Reservoir's Seaport Oracle : co-sign for off chain cancellations & price changes of
listings & bids
Reservoir's Seaport Oracle : co-sign for off chain cancellations & price changes of
* ethOS v2 (mobile OS): native web3 browser, mint NFTs from photos and app store
ethOS v2 (mobile OS): native web3 browser, mint NFTs from photos and app store
Job Listings
* L2BEAT 💗 is hiring a Senior Software Engineer & Product Owner. Apply here!
L2BEAT 💗 is hiring a Senior Software Engineer & Product Owner. Apply here!
* Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
* Immutable is hiring a Protocol Blockchain Engineer .
Immutable is hiring a Protocol Blockchain Engineer .
* Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to
abcoathup.eth on mainnet or Layer 2. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Silvergate Bank winding down
Silvergate Bank winding down
* Silicon Valley Bank closed by California regulator with FDIC as receiver
Silicon Valley Bank closed by California regulator with FDIC as receiver
* US Office of the Investor Advocate cautions relying on Proof of Reserve reports
US Office of the Investor Advocate cautions relying on Proof of Reserve reports
* Simon de la Rouviere: NFT royalties matter , they allow creators to relinquish IP
rights, give away NFTs and still make money to continue creating
Simon de la Rouviere: NFT royalties matter , they allow creators to relinquish IP
General/crypto
* Summer of Protocols : 18 week program, funding full & part time protocol researchers
Summer of Protocols : 18 week program, funding full & part time protocol researchers
* Polynonce : ECDSA key recovery attack using a batch of consecutive & ordered
signatures
Polynonce : ECDSA key recovery attack using a batch of consecutive & ordered signatures
* SHA-3 buffer overflow vulnerability found in several implementations
SHA-3 buffer overflow vulnerability found in several implementations
* Icicle : library for ZK acceleration using CUDA-enabled GPUs, used in Danksharding
builder
Icicle : library for ZK acceleration using CUDA-enabled GPUs, used in Danksharding
* Poseidon2 : optimized version of Poseidon hash function
Poseidon2 : optimized version of Poseidon hash function
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-march-11-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Mar 13 – Shapella community call
Mar 13 – Shapella community call
* Mar 14 – Goerli testnet upgrades to Shapella
Mar 14 – Goerli testnet upgrades to Shapella

Mar 16-18 – ETH Porto

Mar 21 – deadline for Summer of Protocols

Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio

Mar 31 - Apr 2 – ETHSamba (Rio) hackathon & conference

Mar 31 – deadline for EF account abstraction grants round

Apr 14-16 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon

Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon

May 5-10 – ETHTallinn hackathon & NFT Tallinn conference

May 12-14 – ETHGlobal Lisbon

May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)

May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon

May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference

May 26-28 – ETHDublin hackathon

Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul

Jun 2-6 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon

Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Waterloo (changed from Toronto)

Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona

Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)

Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris

Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)

Aug 30 - Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon

Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon

Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference

Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)

Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
